mdRecord.dcterms:title: St. William's College, exterior|detail view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: ... originally built to provide accommodation for priests attached to chantry chapels at nearby York Minster. While the college was not a monastic establishment, it was affected by the Dissolution of the Monasteries; in 1548 the building was converted to a substantial house, In the eighteenth-century, part of the ground floor was used for retail, and bow windows were added. The building was bought by the Province of York in 1902 for use [as offices]. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_William%27s_College [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
